summary:
A Public health expert, educator,  social development and health professional with over 20 years’ experience in Namibia, Southern Africa, and Europe, with governmental non-governmental organizations and academic institutions.  She has  strong analytical skills and considerable experiences in curriculum development, training, capacity building, mentoring and coaching, research programmes, strategic planning, project management, policy and program development. Pandu is interested in understanding how social structures affect individuals and community health, and how cultural, economic, political factors affect health.  She focuses on gaining insights into the what, where, how and why to enable stakeholders to formulate effective policies and programmes.  
Key expertise: •	Training and education in Public health  
•	Program development in  “public Health, Health in all Policy) including SRHR, HIV, and AIDS, Gender, Health and Community systems strengthening 
•	Project management: Fund management and proposal writing
•	Strategic and operational planning and management in  health (public health, health education, promotion and prevention
•	Research mixed-methods focusing on qualitative research ( evaluation, impact. Training (social determinants of health, Health systems, Adolescents, Youth and Orphans, Gender mainstreaming, Gender-Based violence 
•	Assessment, evaluations, impact, operational and case studies and conducting systematic reviews and synthesizing lessons learned; 
•	Voice, Empowerment and accountability ;
